data.text:
Stayed there twice, end of January/beginning of February and end of February. They state 4 stars, but I confirm it is a low level 3 stars hotel. Management is Egyptian-Indian and the quality of the rooms and services is accordingly. As the Chinese saying goes, fish stinks from the head. The hotel caters mainly for lower middle class Indians. 
The check-in at my 2nd stay was pure disaster. Arrived at 1pm. Oficial check-in time was 2pm. So the let me wait one hour. At 2pm they still weren’t able to check me in. They were overtaxed with groups of Indians. Had to leave in order to do my errands. Deposited my luggage and returned at 7pm at which time I still had to wait until the check-in procedure had been carried out completely. Definitely not a 4 stars hotel. 
Room was basicly clean, however not spotless clean – filthy carpets and couches, hair threads  in the bathroom. Sink and bathtub were clogged. Remote control for the TV-set was missing. Poor reception of TV-channels. Lots of channels from the list on the bedside table were missing alltogether. The connection point between shower head and hose was leaky. Talked the snags with the reception staff point by point. They managed to fix them partially. After switching off the TV-set the screen showed a blue display which disappeared only after about 2 hours – hard to fall asleep under such circumstances. Didn’t have any breakfast, however had a stroll around the buffet: cheap products, smell was unbearable. 
Had a guest for short time on my room and they levied a visitor charge of 200 AED (55 USD) which in my opinion is sheer blatant greediness and reflects the criminogenic energy of the management. 
Rest rooms in the lobby area are a disaster: clogged and dirty WCs, no soap, water supply let to desire, water taps defect. My suggestion is to use the toilets on the rooftop. 
Staff was courteous, however not all of them were well trained. Asked the concierge to arrange a restaurant reservation for me and he was simply incapable to tackle it. He had obviously difficulties with tipping Latin letters. Reception assisted with the task. 
On the 5th floor there’s Tehran Club and a bar which are frequented by hordes of Iranian and Central Asian prostitutes, their pimps and clients. Acccordingly, there’s a brisk trade in the lobby and in the lifts during literally every night of the week.
data.title: Poor and blatantly greedy Egyptian-Indian Management

data.text: Nice hotel. Good staff.  Jasbeer and Farnham concierge were very friendly and helpful. The Bar was quiet on the 3 occasions we went the staff gave good service. The pool area was pleasant. Breakfast was good and the Indian buffet dinner had a good selection of dishes. Nice coffe in the coffee shop although a little expensive. I would happily return.
data.title: Nice hotel.

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear Ms. Jenn,

Greetings from Grand Excelsior Hotel Deira

We would like to take the opportunity to thank you for choosing to stay Grand Excelsior Hotel Deira.

It brings us great pleasure to know that your recent visit to our hotel was enjoyable. Your praise to our concierge with friendly and helpful manner is remarkable for us and thank you  for the highlight that you enjoy with our Indian Buffet.   

We do hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back.

Thank You 
The Management | Grand Excelsior Hotel Deira | T: +971 (0)4 2688888
P.O. Box 5772,  Al Muteena Street, Deira, Dubai, UAE
Greetings from Grand Excelsior Hotel Deira

data.text:
definately not a four star hotel
very noisy hotel until 2am .rooms not properly maintained bathroom dirty.Pool area need lots of renovations passages very dark .Staff not very helpful just ignore requests that we made.
other family members bathrooms had cracked bath tubs
data.title: bad hotel

data.text:
This would to say big big thanks to the hotel team , would name particularly night shift reception team (Mr Khaled ) … really they are a true sample of how hotels should serve the clients, their responses to our request has been treated  with   Kindness and smile despite the late time . 

I really thank them and I would keep booking in this hotel for my next visits to Dubai and I would highly recommend this to my freind, colleagues, family.

Again thank you .
data.title: Thanking

data.text: Expected the hotel to be at least clean. Being in the area of old Dubai I did think it would be old but not as tired as it was. The bathroom was terrible to say the least, mould all over, if we had being staying more than one night we would have changed hotels. The breakfast did not cater for international or European guests. Staff were very friendly and helpful.
data.title: Old dubai
